      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static double[] foldChange​(double[] vector1, double[] vector2)  
      static double foldChange​(double value1, double value2)
      Calculate ratio value1/value2
      static double foldChangeGeneExpression​(double[] vector1, double[] vector2, boolean log)
      Vector1 and Vectior2 correspond to three technical replicates, so:
      We calculate the fold change by measuring the relative expression (or ratio) of the median expression of vector1 and vector2
      static double foldChangeGeneExpressionWT​(double[] vector1, double vector2Median, boolean log)
      Use this fonction when comparing a vector to a median value already calculated
      For example when vector2Median is equal to WT average expression
      static double foldChangeTiling​(double[] vector1, double[] vector2, boolean log)
      Vector1 and vector2 are the values of all the probes contained in a specific genome element, so:
      We calculate the difference within vector1-vector2 (probe by probe) And then calculate the median the resulting vector
      static double foldChangeTilingWT​(double[] vector1, double vector2Median, boolean log)  
      static double[] logFC​(double[] vector1, double[] vector2)

      • foldChangeTiling

        public static double foldChangeTiling​(double[] vector1,
                                      double[] vector2,
                                      boolean log)
        Vector1 and vector2 are the values of all the probes contained in a specific genome element, so:
        We calculate the difference within vector1-vector2 (probe by probe) And then calculate the median the resulting vector
        Parameters:
        vector1 -
        vector2 -
        Returns:

      • foldChangeGeneExpression

        public static double foldChangeGeneExpression​(double[] vector1,
                                              double[] vector2,
                                              boolean log)
        Vector1 and Vectior2 correspond to three technical replicates, so:
        We calculate the fold change by measuring the relative expression (or ratio) of the median expression of vector1 and vector2
        Parameters:
        vector1 -
        vector2 -
        log - if true we calculate relative expression, if false we "unlog" and calculate the ratio of expression
        Returns:

      • foldChangeGeneExpressionWT

        public static double foldChangeGeneExpressionWT​(double[] vector1,
                                                double vector2Median,
                                                boolean log)
        Use this fonction when comparing a vector to a median value already calculated
        For example when vector2Median is equal to WT average expression
        Parameters:
        vector1 -
        vector2Median -
        log -
        Returns:
